gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 3,20]]Jesus came with his disciples into the house. Again the crowd gathered, making it impossible for them even to eat.
[[Mc 3,21]]When his relatives heard of this they set out to seize him, for they said, "He is out of his mind."
[[Mc 3,22]]The scribes who had come from Jerusalem said, "He is possessed by Beelzebul," and "By the prince of demons he drives out demons."
[[Mc 3,23]]Summoning them, he began to speak to them in parables, "How can Satan drive out Satan?
[[Mc 3,24]]If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
[[Mc 3,25]]And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
[[Mc 3,26]]And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand; that is the end of him.
[[Mc 3,27]]But no one can enter a strong man's house to plunder his property unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he can plunder his house.
[[Mc 3,28]]Amen, I say to you, all sins and all blasphemies that people utter will be forgiven them.
[[Mc 3,29]]But whoever blasphemes against the holy Spirit will never have forgiveness, but is guilty of an everlasting sin."
[[Mc 3,30]]For they had said, "He has an unclean spirit."
[[Mc 3,31]]His mother and his brothers arrived. Standing outside they sent word to him and called him.
[[Mc 3,32]]A crowd seated around him told him, "Your mother and your brothers (and your sisters) are outside asking for you."
[[Mc 3,33]]But he said to them in reply, "Who are my mother and (my) brothers?"
[[Mc 3,34]]And looking around at those seated in the circle he said, "Here are my mother and my brothers.
[[Mc 3,35]](For) whoever does the will of God is my brother and sister and mother."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 130,1]]Out of the depths I cry to you, O LORD
[[Ps 130,2]]LORD, hear my voice!
Let your ears be attentive
to my voice in supplication.

[[Ps 130,3]]If you, O LORD, mark iniquities,
LORD, who can stand?
[[Ps 130,4a]]But with you is forgiveness,
[[Ps 130,4b]]But with you is forgiveness,

[[Ps 130,4c]]that you may be revered.
[[Ps 130,5]]I trust in the LORD;
my soul trusts in his word.
[[Ps 130,6]]My soul waits for the Lord 
more than sentinels for dawn.

[[Ps 130,7]]For with the LORD is kindness
and with him is plenteous redemption;
[[Ps 130,8]]and he will redeem Israel
from all their iniquities.

second_reading.title: Second Letter to the Corinthians
second_reading.text:
[[2_Co 4,13]]Since, then, we have the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, "I believed, therefore I spoke," we too believe and therefore speak,
[[2_Co 4,14]]knowing that the one who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus and place us with you in his presence.
[[2_Co 4,15]]Everything indeed is for you, so that the grace bestowed in abundance on more and more people may cause the thanksgiving to overflow for the glory of God.
[[2_Co 4,16]]Therefore, we are not discouraged; rather, although our outer self is wasting away, our inner self is being renewed day by day.
[[2_Co 4,17]]For this momentary light affliction is producing for us an eternal weight of glory beyond all comparison,
[[2_Co 4,18]]as we look not to what is seen but to what is unseen; for what is seen is transitory, but what is unseen is eternal.
[[2_Co 5,1]]For we know that if our earthly dwelling, a tent, should be destroyed, we have a building from God, a dwelling not made with hands, eternal in heaven.

first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 3,9]]The LORD God called to the Adam and asked him, “Where are you?”
[[Gn 3,10]]He answered, "I heard you in the garden; but I was afraid, because I was naked, so I hid myself."
[[Gn 3,11]]Then he asked, "Who told you that you were naked? You have eaten, then, from the tree of which I had forbidden you to eat!"
[[Gn 3,12]]The man replied, "The woman whom you put here with me--she gave me fruit from the tree, so I ate it."
[[Gn 3,13]]The LORD God then asked the woman, "Why did you do such a thing?" The woman answered, "The serpent tricked me into it, so I ate it."
[[Gn 3,14]]Then the LORD God said to the serpent: "Because you have done this, you shall be banned from all the animals and from all the wild creatures; On your belly shall you crawl, and dirt shall you eat all the days of your life.
[[Gn 3,15]]I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and hers; He will strike at your head, while you strike at his heel."
